title: Pilot
proverb: Look to the north. Keep looking. There is nothing coming from the south.

title: Glow Cloud
proverb: Men are from Mars. Women are from Venus. Earth is a hallucination. Podcasts are dreams.

title: Station Management
proverb: There's a special place in Hell. It's really hip. Very exclusive.

title: PTA Meeting
proverb: What has four legs in the morning, two legs at noon, and three legs in the evening? I don't know, but I trapped it in my bedroom. Send help.

title: The Shape in Grove Park
proverb: A million dollars isn't cool. You know what's cool? A basilisk.

title: The Drawbridge
proverb: Lost? Confused? Lacking direction? Need to find a purpose in your life?

title: History Week
proverb: It must be 3:23 PM somewhere, maybe space?

title: The Lights in Radon Canyon
proverb: We are living in an immaterial world, a ghost world, and I am an immaterial girl, a ghost.

title: "PYRAMID"
proverb: "Nice bolo tie" is the greatest compliment a person can ever receive.

title: Feral Dogs
proverb: Eating meat is a difficult moral decision, because it's stolen, that meat. You should apologize.

title: Wheat & Wheat By-Products
proverb: Today is the last day of your life, up to this point.

title: The Candidate
proverb: Does the carpet match the drapes? No. It doesn't. You're the worst interior decorator. Please leave my home.

title: A Story About You
proverb: I'd never join a pen15 club that would allow a person like me to become a member.

title: The Man in the Tan Jacket
proverb: Biologically speaking, we are all people made up of smaller people.

title: Street Cleaning Day
proverb: One incorporeal being said to the other, "I'm not here too. Make friends?"

title: The Phone Call
proverb: If I said you had a beautiful body, would it even matter, because we are so insignificant in this vast and incomprehensible universe?

title: Valentine
proverb: Werner Herzog is the most interesting person.

title: The Traveler
proverb: Find more ways to work "plinth" into daily conversation.

title: The Sandstorm
proverb: Step one, write down the names of everyone you know. Step two, rearrange the letters. Step three, this will reveal a great secret of time.

title: The Sandstorm
proverb: Step one, separate your lips. Step two, use facial muscles to pull back corners of mouth. Step three, widen your eyes. This is how to be happy.

title: Poetry Week
proverb: Pain is just weakness leaving the body, and then being replaced by pain. Lots of pain.

title: A Memory of Europe
proverb: Ask your doctor if right is left for you.

title: The Whispering Forest
proverb: If you love someone, set them free. Set them free now. This is the police, and we have you surrounded.

title: Eternal Scouts
proverb: Mamas, don't let your babies grow up to be cowboys. Show them pictures of cows when they're young and administer brief electrical shocks.

title: The Mayor
proverb: The most dangerous game is man. The most entertaining game is Broadway Puppyball. The most esoteric game is weird bear.

title: One Year Later
proverb: A fun game - say 'toy boat' over and over. Do it for the rest of your life. Retreat from society and live on alms. Whisper 'toy boat' as you die.

title: Faceless Old Woman
proverb: The human soul weighs 21 grams, smells like grilled vegetables, looks like a wrinkled tartan quilt, and sounds like bridge traffic.

title: First Date
proverb: Production oversight by Tory Malatea, who is holding a small locket. He's not speaking, he'd just like for you to touch the locket. His hand is twisted, his skin is forming into scales. Just touch it once. Just once, okay?

title: Summer Reading Program
proverb: A bar walks into a bar. The bartender is a snake eating its own tail. The windows look out only onto the face of the one who looks.

title: Subway
proverb: Your body is a temple, a temple of blood rituals and pagan tributes. A lost temple. A temple that needs more calcium. You should maybe try vitamin supplements.

title: Dana
proverb: Look to the sky. You will not find answers there, but you will certainly see what everyone is screaming about.

title: A Blinking Light Up On the Mountain
proverb: Throw your hands in the air. Now your arms. Keep detaching limbs and throwing them in the air. Hopefully the birds will be sated and leave.

title: Yellow Helicopters
proverb: Sticks and stones may break my bones, but words will never quite describe the pain.

title: Cassette
proverb: You can lead a horse to water, and you can lead a horse into water, and you can swim around with the horse and have fun.

title: A Beautiful Dream
proverb: Thank you for your interest in a life free of pain. We are not accepting applications at this time. Please try again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again...

title: Lazy Day
proverb: On this day in history, mundanity and terror and food and love and trees.

title: Missing
proverb: Look, up in the sky! It's a bird! It's a plane! No, it's just the void, infinite and indifferent. We are so small, so very very small.

title: The Auction
proverb: Listen, I'm not a hero. The real heroes are the people who point out to us when protesters have smartphones, thus invalidating all concerns.
